comment: Sometimes she simplifies things too much, and the study guides and ppts aren't always representative of the tests. There is weekly homework online. The class isn't as organized as I like. She is sweet and her policies are lenient, but don't take advantage of them or she will revoke them--she changed her homework policy the last week due to cheating

Nursing majors definitely take her. Try to sit in the front b/c of her soft voice. Great personality and fair grader. Curved tests are so helpful! Some negatives: She doesn't post grades (you must email) and homework is tricky and takes time (but very helpful for tests). I didn't use a book, google/youtube was my best friend. Effort/timeA :)
Wonderful lab professor! I had to drop my chem 2 lecture and I was still able to make an A in this lab with her. She is always there to help and answer any of your questions.

She is a fantastic professor who has great knowledge of the subject. She is very helpful and makes sure you have a good understanding of the subject. I learned so much more about chemistry than I did in my lecture. I highly recommend this professor to any student taking a Chem 1211 lab.

She is a fantastic professor who has great knowledge of the subject. She is very helpful and makes sure you have a good understanding of the subject. I highly recommend this professor to any student taking a Chem 1211 lab.

Dr. Hartwig is an amazing professor. She motivates you to keep going, even when you want to give up. She gives one extra credit assignment and if after the four exams you have an A, you will opt out of the final. Take her you wont regret it.

TAKE HER, TAKE HER! *She is very helpful, approachable, reasonable and fair. *Tests are not easy, but it's because of subject matter. *Gives 1 extra credit assignment. * She curves tests and you can opt out of the final if you have an A going into it!  *Go to the SI sessions and the textbook is a must read. I would definitely take her again!

Amazing professor! This class is extremely difficult but she honestly tries her hardest to help all her students pass. Lots of reading involved. She lets you opt out of final if you get an A before. Drops lowest exam grade. Definitely would take again!

Sometimes takes a little to get back to emails. She wants you to succeed, but  YOU have to give 110% effort. Test are taught, but you either know the answer or you do not. Go to class! She hints what problems might be on exam. Print out lecture notes before class. She goes over a lot and you will not be able to write it all down.

Amazing teacher! Very helpful and knowledgeable. I would definitely take her again if I need too. She's also a great lab teacher, very clear and gracious in grading and lets you know exactly what was wrong. If you wanna pass: -Print off the lecture notes -Don't skip class -Record the lectures -Sit close to the front (she's a little soft spoken)

Extremely sweet professor. She will help you if you need it. The class is extremely tough, but Prof Hartwig does her best to help her students understand the material. You need the textbook, this class requires a lot of studying if you want to pass. I had her for lab as well, and she is very helpful in the lab. She is easy to approach, I recommend.

Dr. Hartwig is very sweet and very willing to help all her students. While she is very laid back in writing up the labs, she makes up for it making sure you have the correct answers. She does tend to speak very quietly,  and can be difficult to hear over the white noise in the lab. The final is nasty, but is not her fault, since it is a standard.

Sweetest professor EVER. She is the one to take for Organic Bio chem!! Definitely a class that makes you work for your grade, but, print her powerpoints before lecture, Practice practice, go to SI, and Dr. hartwig makes it very possible for an A!!

She is so sweet and approachable, shes like a Disney princess. Her tests are tough. There are 4, 1 can be dropped and Sappling homework counts as one exam grade. I did terrible the first 2 exams and made B's on the last couple. Its a hard class, but if you print out her powerpoints and go to class, you can pass it. Would take again.

She is very approachable and very helpful on lab reports. Unfortunately because the lab final is department wide, it is super hard. I failed the final and finished with an 89 and she didn't round up. Eh, still made an A in lecture so I guess it works out.

Professor Hartwig was great! Organic and biochemistry are not easy subjects and I was nervous before I took the course. The first test I failed, but I came to her and let her know I needed a B in her class. So she helped me obtain outside resources to improve my grade and I ended up with a B so close to an A! I would recommend taking her class!
didn't expect to make an A in this class. A lot of reading, studying, and hard work but it is possible. Definitely take her.

she flies through powerpoints in her lecture. attend class sometimes what she talks about is on the exam. there's sapling homework, four exams, and a final. she's there for you if you need help but you have to work for the grade. the exam questions are really tricky. she's really a nice lady but shes soft spoken so try to sit near the front!

Took her for lecture and lab. She is super clear on lab reports and always willing to help . In lecture she does kind of speed through the powerpoints so make sure you ask questions, read the book, and attend the SI sessions. Overall she is a really great professor who cares about her students and wants you to succeed. Highly recommend her.

Positives - Drops your lowest exam grade out of 4 exams total; Assigns homework on Sapling that counts as a full test grade; sweet personality; hw is due the same time as exam. Negatives - She goes really fast in her lecturing; her exam questions are tough, ques are tricky, you're only tested on 23-25 things, which is not beneficial to your odds.

Miss Hartwig is a sweetheart. I recommend going to class as much as you can! If you ask questions that begin with "So on the test will we have to know ___?" she'll be very clear on what you'll need to know! Also, GO TO REVIEW SESSIONS! THEY'RE SO HELPFUL! and work together on the homework - that's what saved my grade

Best teacher i've ever had! She is always there for you if you have any questions and she is the nicest person in the world. Her tests are hard, but it is organic chemistry. She will do anything in her ability to help you with anything that you need.

She is great! Chem 1152 is a tough class, but she is invested in her students and wants us to do well! She responds to emails promptly and it really helps to go to her office hours. She also posts a practice exam that has most of the concepts on the test! Go to class and read the book and an A is possible.

Cortnie Hartwig is by far the best teacher I have had at Kennesaw State. She really knows her chemistry and you can tell she really enjoys her job. She really wants to help you do great in the class. She will help you during office hours or even take out time to hold reviews for hard tests. She sometimes curves tests also. She is great for nursing.

Professor Hartwig is so amazing! Organic and Biochem is not an easy class but she will make sure you know what is on the tests! She is letting us exempt if we have an A going into the final! I love her!! She will meet with you any time and will basically tell you what to know for the test.
Wonderful professor!!! She is so incredibly sweet and easy to approach :)
Take her! Shes phenomenal. Very clear about what she expects, grades fairly... posts stuff on d2l regularly.  Cant say enough good things! best lab at ksu so far
Helps review your lab report before you turn it in. Great prof!
Great lab professor. There to help if you need her. Clear about how she wants the notebook formatted. Clear on write ups
